alert.note: Alert for Chester; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 4:49AM EST until December 19 at 3:16PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Norristown affecting Montgomery, Philadelphia, and Chester Counties. For the Schuylkill River...including Philadelphia near 30th Street, Berne, Reading, Pottstown, Norristown, Philadelphia...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schuylkill River at Norristown. * WHEN...From this morning to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Flooding occurs in West Norriton. The West Indian Lane bridge begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Water begins to cover and close Riverview Boulevard in West Norriton. At 15.0 feet, River Road in West Conshohocken begins to flood. The lower garages at the Riverview Landing and the Lofts at Valley Forge start to take on water. The lower section of Port Indian Road in West Norriton becomes impassable. At 16.0 feet, The Upper Merion Boathouse starts to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 15.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.0 feet on 09/18/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Norristown 13.0 11.5 Mon 3 am 13.3 11.1 15.8 7pm 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM EST.
